content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the final simplified passage

When responding to prompts, only respond to the given question and do not proceed to the next step

Algorithm parameters are as follows.
DC: Average person
ILT: Medium-High

The passage is provided in the following message

As various kinds of output devices emerged, such as highresolution printers or a display of PDA(Personal Digital Assistant), the importance of high-quality resolution conversion has been increasing. This paper proposes a new method for enlarging image with high quality. One of the largest problems on image enlargement is the exaggeration of the jaggy edges. To remedy this problem, we propose a new interpolation method, which uses artificial neural network to determine the optimal values of interpolated pixels. The experimental results are shown and evaluated. The effectiveness of our methods is discussed by comparing with the conventional methods.
FKGL score of the the latest passage version is 12.585454545454546

Since the FKGL (Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level) score of the latest passage version is 12.585454545454546, which is above the desired complexity (DC: Average person), we need to simplify the passage.

Please proceed with the algorithm to propose a simplification of the identified section.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (Average person)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage. Remember to respect the ILT (Medium-High) contraint. Only provide the identified section

"One of the largest problems on image enlargement is the exaggeration of the jaggy edges. To remedy this problem, we propose a new interpolation method, which uses artificial neural network to determine the optimal values of interpolated pixels."
Simplify this section. Only provide the proposed simplification
"One of the main problems with image enlargement is the distortion of edges. To fix this, we propose a new method using a neural network to improve the quality of the image."
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage

As various kinds of output devices emerged, such as high-resolution printers or a display of PDA(Personal Digital Assistant), the importance of high-quality resolution conversion has been increasing. This paper proposes a new method for enlarging image with high quality. One of the main problems with image enlargement is the distortion of edges. To fix this, we propose a new method using a neural network to improve the quality of the image. The experimental results are shown and evaluated. The effectiveness of our methods is discussed by comparing with the conventional methods.

Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original. Comparison must be between the originally provided (the very first) passage and the current simplified version. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The original passage mentions "jaggy edges" as the problem, while the simplified version uses "distortion of edges", which is a less specific term. This represents a moderate information loss (IL: 4/10). The original passage also mentions "interpolation method, which uses artificial neural network to determine the optimal values of interpolated pixels", while the simplified version only mentions a "neural network to improve the quality of the image", resulting in a high information loss (IL: 8/10) since the original description is more specific and accurate. Overall, the information loss is moderate to high (IL: 6/10) compared to the original passage.
What is the highest severity level identified in your last answer? Is it higher than ILT (Medium-High)? Provide the highest severity level, followed by an answer to the ILT question as "Yes" or "No"
Accept the proposed simplification. Print the updated version of the passage, do not print anything else
